title: Einstein Analytics Account Executive
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategorySalesJob DetailsAbout Tableau, a Salesforce companyTableau helps people see and understand data. Our analytics platform fuels exploration, allowing you to quickly answer questions with data and share insights across your organization. Global enterprises, early-stage startups, nonprofits, and governments all use Tableau’s intuitive software to quickly transform their data into actionable insights. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!What you’ll be doing...Do you have strong opinions on how retailers can use predictive intelligence to create a data-driven experiences? Perhaps you know how real time analytics can help large enterprise companies place the right product, on the right shelf, at the right time? Or maybe you're passionate about showing clients how disruptive augmented AI & analytics can really be?!We are data ambassadors tasked with driving an intelligence revolution, and we are growing our Einstein Analytics team in Tableau!As an Account Executive within the Tableau Sales team you will sell the smartest analytics suite for every business user. Einstein Analytics combines dynamic, interactive data visualization with the power of machine learning to deliver insights and data-driven applications for every business user. The Account Executive will formulate and execute a Einstein Analytics sales strategy within South East Asia (SEA), drive revenue growth by penetrating the current customer base, and develop new customers in their segment. You will work in partnership with the existing Account owners and will carry quota for the Einstein Analytics product sales in their region.You will be responsible for some of the world’s premier enterprise accounts in SEA. You will work closely with your customers as a trusted adviser to deeply understand their unique company challenges and goals. You will consult with customers on the Einstein Analytics suite to evangelize solutions that will help them reach their business goals and blaze new trails within their organizations. You will contribute to our business growth in a fast paced, collaborative and fun atmosphere, as a valued member of our Tableau Sales Team.Who you are...Highly driven individual with an execution focus and a strong sense of urgency and a belief in Einstein/Tableau mission. You can go beyond relationship management.A mix of business curiosity combined with a technical aptitude to truly solve customer challenges and earn trust.At least 6-8+ years of quota carrying software or technology sales and account management experienceSolution selling mindset: develop a plan and solution, articulate ROI, and navigate complexities of our customers to drive revenueWork well within a team of various stakeholders (client directors, solution engineers, etc.)Experience with CRM, analytics, data, databases, predictive modeling, or business intelligence strongly preferred.Bachelor's Degree with a technical or business focus preferred.Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. title: Product Lead
description: Who we areZinier's intelligent field service automation platform helps organizations transform how they coordinate and execute work so they can solve problems faster, fix things before they break, and maintain the infrastructure that we rely on every day. Field service organizations around the world use Zinier to connect all their teams and data in one place and supercharge every aspect of their field service operations. We are a global team headquartered in Silicon Valley with leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ Capital, Founders Fund, Newfund Capital, NGP Capital, Tiger Global Management and Qualcomm Ventures LLC.Why we existServices shape how we live. Electricity lights up our homes. The Internet opens up our worlds. Cellular phones keep us connected no matter where we are. We take for granted the things we can turn on with the flip of a switch. But when even one of the services we depend on isn't available, the day can quickly start to go sideways.For organizations that provide these services, some of the most important work happens in the field — in neighborhoods, across open spaces, and along millions of last miles that criss-cross the country. Every moment of downtime matters, which is why Zinier exists. Zinier empowers organizations to work smarter — from the main office to the field — to solve problems quickly, fix things before they break, and keep people in the rhythm of their days.To do this, Zinier has created a scalable platform powered by AI-driven insights and intelligent automation that helps field service teams work smarter, better, faster, and more efficiently. We help organizations automate routine tasks so the people in the field can focus on putting their expertise to work. We work with customers in telecom and energy.What we're looking forWe are currently expanding our rockstar product team in preparation for the design and launch of the next generation of our platform - a product that powers industry's leading field service automation platform and meets the needs of our Enterprise clients in a revolutionary new way complete with an updated look/feel and powerful new technology stack.It sounds a bit cliche, but our product team is on a mission to create a truly beautiful and easy-to-use platform/ interface. The design and usability of Enterprise products tends to be WAY behind consumer products. Our aim is to close that gap.Role ResponsibilitiesLead one or more product squads, composed designers, engineers and quality analysts.Drive cross-team collaboration, set feature priorities and create product roadmap to achieve company visions.Bridge the gap between design and engineering by being the person responsible for communicating the design solutions to engineering in a clear and concise manner.Write detailed product requirements for both design and engineering.Work closely with engineering and design to ensure projects are delivered on-time as per specifications.Inspire our design team to deliver excellent solutions that fit business/product goals while keeping technical constraints in mind.Capture use cases from our customers and solutions team, and help develop the feedback and iteration cycle, understanding that user research for enterprise products comes with a unique set of challenges.Role Requirements:8+ years of experience as product manager and 12+ years experience in the software industry.Track record working very closely with designers and engineers on a breadth of projects, both web and mobile.Experience building B2B / Enterprise Platforms from the ground up. Experience with Platforms as a Service a plus.Experience leading via agile and scrum methodologies.While you do not need to be a developer, a strong technical background is required to be able to understand complex platform and database configurations so that you are able to convey requirements to engineering. Exposure to AI/ML is preferred.Experience managing your team's schedule to meet aggressive deadlines.Strong communication skills used to build consensus, alignment, and relationships with diplomacy across teams with different goals, functions, and initiatives.You are self-motivated, with a knack for strategic, technical and creative problem-solving.AI, Machine Learning

title: Intern (Machine Learning)
description: Job Opening ID: 124028Singapore, SingaporeFull-TimeIntern / CoopCompany OverviewCalling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.Who are we? We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. The future is calling. Will you answer?Group/DivisionWith over 40 years of semiconductor process control experience, chipmakers around the globe rely on KLA to ensure that their fabs ramp next-generation devices to volume production quickly and cost-effectively. Enabling the movement towards advanced chip design, KLA's Global Products Group (GPG), which is responsible for creating all of KLA’s metrology and inspection products, is looking for the best and the brightest research scientist, software engineers, application development engineers, and senior product technology process engineers.The LS-SWIFT Division of KLA’s Global Products Group provides patterned wafer inspection systems for high-volume semiconductor manufacturing. Its mission is to deliver market-leading cost of ownership in defect detection for a broad range of applications in the production of semiconductors. Customers from the foundry, logic, memory, automotive, MEMS, advanced packaging and other markets rely upon high-sample wafer inspection information generated by LS-SWIFT products.LS (Laser Scanning) systems enable cost-effective patterned wafer defect detection for the industry’s most sophisticated process technologies deployed in leading-edge foundry, logic, DRAM, and NAND fabs. SWIFT (Simultaneous Wafer Inspection at Fast Throughput) systems deliver all-wafer-surface (frontside, backside, and edge) macro inspection that is critical for automotive IC, MEMS, and advanced packaging processes as well as foundry/logic and memory fabs.LS-SWIFT operates from a global footprint that includes the US, Singapore, India and Germany, and serves a worldwide customer base across Asia, Europe and North America.ResponsibilitiesProject Name / Title: Data analysis and improvement for ML application.Description / Scope of Project:Targeted data analytics for sites with ML roll-out to assess stabilityAssist in analysis of ML logging data from the field for troubleshooting purposes and provide guidance to field teamsImprove ML BKMs and develop new DL training templates based on field learningQualificationsPre-requisites / Preferred field of study:Computer engineering/EE with some programming background ( python, C++, Matlab)

title: Computer Scientist (IRP JPS MKG)
company: Cambridge Centre for Advanced Research and Educati...
description: Who are we?We are the University of Cambridge presence in Singapore called Cambridge CARES, sponsored by the NRF CREATE program CAM.CREATE. The research programme Cambridge Centre for Carbon Reduction in Chemical Technology (C4T) is a joint Cambridge, NTU and NUS research activity within Cambridge CARES.Our team is comprised of world-class scientists and engineers working in a vibrant, fast-paced environment with great opportunities for knowledge and skills development.Who are we looking for?Urban growth is driving the need for sustainable operational models for city planning. Simultaneously, the proliferation of urban data has introduced a fragmentation into myriad types, formats, and qualities, hindering data integration into urban planning. The project aims to address one of the grand challenges in urban planning today: to connect and catalyse the unprecedented growth of cities and the exponential proliferation of data. The project will develop a Master-planning Knowledge Graph, transforming the conventional instrument of urban planning–the city master-plan–into a knowledge management system that supports cross-domain evaluations of planning proposals by enabling the integration of siloed data, software tools and Application Programming Interfaces from disparate knowledge domains. The overall goal is, using ideas from Smart Nation, Internet of Things, the Semantic Web, machine learning, and statistics, to create a system allowing planners to explore and compare more variations and more iterations for a particular development proposal, leading to improved master plans.The successful candidate will be expected to assume intellectual leadership in the development of the theoretical and mathematical foundations as well as the wider, ongoing development of our main software tool. This will involve keeping abreast of the latest web technologies, making key design decisions, and ensuring their realisation. Being part of a 2-member consortium will require close interaction with collaborators. Activities will include participating in research discussions with local industries and partners, overseas universities, and writing reports as required by the National Research Foundation (NRF) of Singapore.What skills do you have?1. A PhD degree in a relevant discipline such as mathematics, computer science, (theoretical) physics/chemistry, software engineering, or a related subject ideally involving semantic technologies and/or description logics.2. Excellent mathematical and programming skills.3. An understanding of the software development lifecycle and design patterns.4. Experienced in working with a diverse range of data types.5. Willingness and capable to acquire software skills and knowledge about modern technologies.6. Computational thinking with proven ability to conduct independent research and an outstanding publication record in at least one of the research areas concerned.7. Proactive problem solver with critical thinking and attention to details.8. Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.9. The ability to work as part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of researchers.What can we offer you?A stimulating working-environment with friendly, highly motivated colleagues.Opportunities to develop and implement new ideas in a creative environment.A competitive salary in line with your skills and experience.A one-year contract in the first instance, extendable following satisfactory performance.A comprehensive medical insurance cover as part of your employment.Please note this post is mainly based in the CREATE Tower at NUS University Town, Singapore and is likely to be suitable for recent graduates.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $6,000.00 - $8,000.00 per monthExperience:Mathematics: 5 years (Preferred)Software Engineering: 5 years (Preferred)Computer Science: 5 years (Preferred)Education:Master's (Preferred)Work Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

title: NTI Senior/Principal Engineer - Dry Etch
description: Micron’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Join an inclusive team focused on one thing: using our expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we create help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can spark the very innovation we are pursuing.Req. ID: 228284We are looking for a high energy, ambitious, result driven individual with strong work ethic and integrity to join us as a Dry Etch Process Development Senior/ Principal Engineer in NAND Technology Integration (NTI) R&D group. You will be using state of the art equipment to support activities associated with rapid deployment of technology nodes, process margin improvement activities and ensure extended engagement with manufacturing on the upcoming technology nodes.You are responsible for, but are not limited to, the following:Develop and optimize unit processes to meet the yield and quality requirements of advanced Replacement Gate 3D NAND partsQuantify benefits of innovative process and/or equipment solutions to enable early experimentation and adoption for process margin improvementPrioritize within Singapore based manufacturing Dry Etch team on the key technology issues that need R&D breakthroughs.Integrate and troubleshoot processes as part of cross-functional teams driving yield and quality improvementParticipate with Boise R&D peers on technology choices for the upcoming nodes and able to translate future technology device needs into clear process requirementsIdentify disruptive processes early on and work to identify viable path forwardProcess development will include performing fundamental research, hardware evaluations, as well as testing processes for novel applications and generating intellectual property relevant to Micron.Identify process simplification opportunities and drive multi-functional teams in implementationIncorporate best known manufacturing methods into early development phase of upcoming nodes.Design and implement advanced process monitoring and control methodologies.Provide advice and counsel to management on significant technical issues. Lead and initiate ground breaking projects through patents/technical papers.Communicate and collaborate with partners both locally and globally. Strict adherence to Micron Intellectual Property protection policy is a requirement.Be part of the continuous worldwide R&D engagement with suppliers pushing for breakthrough solutions.You should possessBachelor/Masters/PhD in Electrical & Electronics, Chemical, Mechanical, Materials Engineering.In depth understanding of dry etch principles, techniques, challenges and methodologies.Strong aptitude for research and development and ability to create production-worthy technologies.Ability to develop and maintain relations with multi-functional teams and vendors.Strong communication skills (written, verbal and presentation).Proficient in statistics, data analysis, Design of Experiments (DOE) and comfortable with analysis software tools.Highly motivated and adaptable to our demanding, dynamic and rapidly changing work environment; flexibility to work for extended hours, as required.Ability to travel to US R&D site for few months to engage in collaborative R&D work.Possess the above qualities ? Join Us !Working location : Fab10N, 1 North Coast Drive, Singapore 757432About MicronAs the leader in innovative memory solutions, Micron is helping the world make sense of data by delivering technology that is transforming how the world uses information. Through our global brands — Micron, Crucial and Ballistix — we offer the industry’s broadest portfolio. We are the only company manufacturing today’s major memory and storage technologies: DRAM, NAND, NOR and 3D XPoint™ memory. Our solutions are purpose built to demonstrate the value of data to unlock financial insights, accelerate scientific breakthroughs and enhance communication around the world.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.About Micron Technology, Inc.We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careersAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.Micron prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations and other international and industry labor standards.Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.For US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 or 208-368-4748 and/or by completing our General Contact FormKeywords: Singapore || North West (SG-03) || Singapore (SG) || Technology Development || Experienced || Regular || Engineering || #LI-ST1 || Tier 4 ||

title: Senior Staff Engineer (Solar)
description: About Envision DigitalEnvision Digital is a world leading Energy IoT Platform provider, who owns the intelligent IoT platform, EnOS™, currently managing 100GW+ of renewable energy assets globally. Envision Digital is headquartered in Singapore with international offices in China, France, Germany, Norway, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom and the United States. Envision Group's mission is to "solve the challenges for a sustainable future” and is committed to creating a world of beautiful energy where everyone has access to clean, secure and affordable energy.Roles and Responsibilities:We are seeking a candidate with strong technical background in PV, to join a fast growing team in digitalization of renewable energy and energy IoT at Envision Digital Singapore HQ office. You will work closely with a global team of talented solar veterans and cross-functional teams, and given the responsibilities of key customers engagement, helping to solve their renewable energy asset management problems, as well as actively contributing to solar product development.Contribute through deep technical expertise and know-how to development of advanced solar software products and solutions,Building technical relationships with solar asset owners, developers, EPC and O&M companies, in the APAC region;In support of sales and marketing activities, meet with customers, lead solar software product demo and UAT sessions, understand customers’ needs, and defines appropriate solutions. Assist in the determination of new business opportunities and make recommendations on the technical resources needed to participate in new businesses. Assists in the development of business plans and go-to-market strategies.Act as solar subject matter expert, directly involved in solar projects. In additional, support other renewable energy and projects such as solar + battery storage, smart grid, etc.Acts as a thought leader in the field, e.g., appearing at conferences and trade shows, authoring articles and papers; Market-facing exposure to help drive product recognition and adoption; Assist in the development of marketing materials.Generate product insights based on customer feedback, identified feature requests, pain points, for continuous enhancement and refinement of Envision’s existing products, adding new analytics methods and tools.Travel is required.Desired Skills and Experience:Master’s degree or above in Engineering or equivalent, with minimum of 5 years of experience in solar industry;Strong background in PV system technologies, solar farm design, monitoring and control, operation and maintenance, performance modeling, and/or performance engineering and analytics are highly desirable;Solid knowledge of data communication protocols, solar SCADA and cloud-based monitoring systems, performance analytics;Expertise and experience in any one of the following will be a significant plus: wind energy, energy storage systems, demand response, microgrid, power systems, cloud computing, and machine learning;Demonstrated ability to work in a cross-functional team environment and in matrix organizations,Strong communications skills and demonstrated experience in communicating and operating within a multinational corporation and engaging with audiences at different levels. Ability to bridge language and cultural barriers.

title: Research Fellow (PIPS)
company: Cambridge Centre for Advanced Research and Educati...
description: Who are we?We are the University of Cambridge presence in Singapore called Cambridge CARES, sponsored by the NRF CREATE program CAM.CREATE. CARES also hosts industry-funded and other agencies funded projects. Our team is comprised of world-class scientists and engineers working in a vibrant, fast-paced environment with great opportunities for knowledge and skills development.CARES is a partner in the Pharma Innovation Programme Singapore (PIPS). The core partners of PIPS are: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*Star), The National University of Singapore (NUS), the Nanyang Technological University (NTU), the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), and pharma companies GlaxoSmithKline (GSK), MSD International GmbH (Singapore branch), and Pfizer Asia Pacific.Within PIPS, CARES is leading a project “DEVELOPMENT OF MULTI-STEP PROCESSES IN PHARMA”, which aims to transform the way how manufacturing processes are developed within the context of pharma. The project will include research developments in the areas of process systems engineering, machine learning and automated experimental systems. The outcomes of the project are expected to be directly transferred to the industrial partners.Who are we looking for?We are looking to fill a vacancy of a Research Fellow with experience in process development and machine learning. description: Micron’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. ID: 227881DescriptionAs a NAND Photolithography Process Development Engineer in the NAND Technology Integration (NTI) at Micron Technology Inc., you will be responsible for rapid deployment of innovative NAND process technologies, drive development efforts prior to device ramp, define & execute effective actions to enable solutions required to hit key milestones & achieve the required performance within timelines. As an Process Development Photolithography Engineer, you will work with Micron engineers, technology partners and vendors to develop and improve unit processes and be part of cross-functional teams.Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:o Advanced process development tasks such as performing material evaluations, imaging process window analysis, improvements using reticle, layout, OPC improvements & Overlay optimization, in 3D NAND technology.o Troubleshoot processes as part of cross-functional teams driving yield and quality improvement. Be independent and have high initiative to pick up and own areas of improvement. Be comfortable with co-owning areas of improvement with other Fabs and TD teams.o Participate with other Fab photo team peers on technology choices for the upcoming nodes and able to translate future technology device needs into clear process requirements.o Identify disruptive processes early on and work with Fabs to identify viable path forward.o Identify process simplification opportunities and drive cross functional teams in implementationo Incorporate best known manufacturing methods into early development phase of upcoming nodes.Successful candidates for this position will have:o Bachelor/Masters/PhD in Electrical & Electronics, Chemical, Materials Engineering.o Understanding of optics including the principles and application of immersion lithography, polarized illumination.o Experience with chemical process specific to lithography, including materials for 365, 248, and 193nm lithography.o Experience with lithography simulation software and application to low k1 imaging is an added advantage.o Understanding of metrology principles, techniques, challenges and methodologies.o Strong aptitude for technology development and ability to create production-worthy technologies.o Ability to develop and maintain relations with cross-functional teams and vendors.o Strong communication skills (written, verbal and presentation).o Proficient in statistics, data analysis, Design of Experiments (DOE) and comfortable with analysis software tools.o Ability to travel to US TD site for few months to engage in collaborative R&D work.GJS : E2 to E5Working location : Fab10N, 1 North Coast Drive, Singapore 757432About Micron Technology, Inc.We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. title: Electrical Engineer (Mass spectrometry)
description: Job Title: Electrical Engineer (Mass Spectrometry)Job Overview:Breathonix is a spin-off company from NUS (National University of Singapore) that focuses on the development and commercialization of easy breath tests for disease detection using its proprietary breath sampling technique and data analysis algorithms. Our technology allows us to perform a breath test in 1 minute, the fastest in this field. Current focus areas include lung cancer and COVID-19, with additional R&D pipelines in plan for other diseases.As of now, clinical trials for both lung cancer and COVID-19 have yielded promising results. We are currently working towards deploying our rapid breath test for mass COVID-19 screening at airports, hotels and various areas around Singapore with high human traffic. Discussions are ongoing for the collaboration with various government agencies for the mass deployment of our device. Breathonix is now taking off and actively expanding its team.A key component of the breath testing system is the mass spectrometer. The job of the electrical engineer is to operate, maintain and experiment with mass spectrometers (PTR-MS). Understanding of the working principles of the PTR-MS, including its components and software is crucial for this job. The equipment should also be kept at optimal condition to serve as a medical device.Responsibilities and Duties:Operation of medical device (breath sampler, mass spectrometer)Improving electrical instruments and components within our systemIn charge of establishing and maintaining standard operating procedures for the installation and maintenance of devices under our care (deployed and in the office)Training of team members and end users on the usage of our devicePreparing specifications and engineering drawings when necessary for product designQualificationsCandidates must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree (2nd upper and above) in Electrical Engineering or equivalent.Knowledge in the following:Experience in mass spectrometry (not limited to PTR-MS)Experience in equipment calibrationo Able to handle a dynamic and fast-paced start up environmento Only Singaporeans and PRs can applySalary & Benefits:$3500-$4500 based on skills and experiencesEntitlement to stock options after 1 year with the companyTrainings about breath VOC analysis, machine learning algorithm will be providedImmersion into the entrepreneurial ecosystem provided by Breathonix together with NUS Enterprise, Enterprise Singapore and other organizations.Silicon Valley-style of working environment and community. Opportunities to bond with top entrepreneurs in deep-tech.Interested applicants are invited to write-in/send with comprehensive resume including current and expected salary to dufang@breathonix.com

There are lots of improvement and introduction of new features in NVMe. PSPP (PCIe Speed Power Policy) is one of the newly introduced feature from Advanced Micro Devices, Inc (AMD) to save power of the NVMe devices based on the IO bandwidth without compromising on the performance.Candidate will work with the SSD Validation team to understand the validation process and strategy and apply the experience in bringing up the new test methodology to test and validate the AMD PSPP feature (recommended to use python code base). During the process, the candidate will also be introduced to the BIOS UEFI shell tool to explore the capabilities of aforementioned tool. This will involve script, software system design.Improvement of data visualization and debug capability through a database approachCandidate will participate in project development work that automates a manual SSD validation process, with the aim of delivering a functional solution to reduce manual intervention in validation and debug. title: Software Engineer
description: Arcstone Overview:Founded in 2013, Arcstone has successfully delivered solutions to global and innovative companies based in Singapore, the United States, and across Southeast Asia. Its in-house platform called the Arcstone Operations Platform (arc.ops) integrates with IoT sensors, machines, ERPs, and workstation tablets for fully automated to fully manual processes in manufacturing, machine maintenance and warehousing.We are keen to find the best and keeping the best to help propel Arcstone forward. This includes experts from enterprise software development, manufacturing engineering talent to exceptional business developers in the manufacturing space. If you feel you’re ready to join a fast paced, rapidly growing company in a field poised for disruption, we’d like to hear from you!What will be your role?In order to provide the best possible solutions to our clients, Arcstone requires exceptional talent ever ready to assume key roles in meeting our client’s varied manufacturing needs. We are looking for talented problems solvers that can not only bring creative and practical solutions, but also ones that are always passionate to learn on the job.As a Software Developer, you will be working with a talented team in creating customized software solutions for our clients. You will be directly responsible for the development of new modules and features directly related to the manufacturing shop floor and any of the necessary functions as required by existing, new or internally designed features and modules.You will also be client facing to perform fact finding and interviews to ensure that Arcstone is always developing on the cutting edge of features to be used across different manufacturing facilities regardless of the industry. In addition to new client work, you will also be involved in the research and development of the company as we are currently in the process of developing ground-breaking work on the utilization of machine learning and artificial intelligence for the manufacturing industry.What will be your area of focus?Devise and develop software solutions to solve present and potential manufacturing problems utilizing the some of the world’s most advanced IoT sensors and toolsLiaise with our engineers to iterate constantly and maximize value for the customer, alwaysWork with a global team to solve some of world’s most complex manufacturing problems and to coordinate, develop and integrate solutions that have a direct impact on the manufacturing floorResearch and propose the right technologies and architecture for new projectsPerform work requests for software changes and enhancementsRelentlessly and swiftly execute on deliverables with precision and good judgmentWhat are the requirements of the job?BA/BS from a globally recognized university. We are looking for folks who have succeeded academically and professionally at the highest levels.1 – 3 years of software development experience, ideally in enterprise software companiesStrong professional experience in WPF and VB.NET/C#/.net Core/ASP.NETDeep understanding of OOP, SOLID principles and Design PatternsExperience working in ASP.NET MVC, WCF, and SQL ServerExperience working with Entity FrameworkKnowledge of DevExpress is a plusComfort with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a dynamic business landscape; flexible with no 9 to 5 mentalitySelf-motivated and driven to excel and deliver, able to handle stress with a positive attitudeThe Right Fit:We at Arcstone are extremely passionate about the product, the service we provide for our customers, and the transformation we are making in the manufacturing industry. We are looking for people who can bring that same level of passion and zeal for our mission.Our core belief is to hire the right person for the company, and that means looking for someone with truly amazing potential and can grow along with the rest of the company.Our core values:Never give upDo what is neededBe good to each otherAlways be responsiveFocus on the customerAlways be curiousLead with integrityThink at scaleDo carefully consider the requirements before submitting your application.We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Business Development Manager - APJ
description: What’s your mission?At IronNet Cybersecurity, our mission is simple:To deliver the power of collective cybersecurity to defend companies, sectors, and nations. In response to cyber adversaries who increasingly collaborate for collective offense, leading organizations in our critical infrastructure are using collective defense strategies and solutions to meet these powerful and ever-changing threats. We believe that collective defense is our collective responsibility and we are leading the charge.IronNet delivers unmatched collective cyber threat detection for enterprise on-premise, cloud, and hybrid networks. We do this through the application of advanced behavioral analytics, AI, and machine learning techniques. Our team combines the tradecraft knowledge of the best offensive and defensive cyber operators in the world with world-class mathematicians and data scientists to engineer solutions that empower companies to defend against advanced threats.IronNet is recognized in Gartner’s 2019 Market Guide for Network Traffic Analysis and was recently named a Vendor to Watch by Enterprise Management Associates. Our founder and Co-CEO, General (Ret) Keith Alexander, is a recognized cybersecurity innovator and a frequent speaker about current cyberthreats and effective defenses. We have a leadership team with deep government and commercial cyber experience and are advised by a board of esteemed security and venture investment professionals.Your Role:The Business Development Manager - APJ role supports IronNet's sales teams by engaging with cybersecurity professionals and generating new business pipeline. You'll do this by following up on inbound leads as well as leveraging outbound prospecting techniques. The BDM is the lifeblood of the sales organization, of our business and your contributions don’t go unnoticed. IronNet rewards exceptional performance and provides opportunities for professional development and growth within the organization. You can chart your own path to greatness! Your Opportunity:Research target accounts for outbound prospecting campaignsEngage in outbound call and email activities to generate new sales opportunitiesFollow up on inbound sales inquiriesSchedule meetings and product demonstrations for sales reps after proper account and lead qualificationPromote IronNet events and webinars in your respective regionWork intimately with regional leadership and marketing teams to align and execute plans.What You'll Need:The desire to learn and growAn interest in sales, marketing or client support and the desire to learn and grow your careerThe energy, determination, and creativity to find a path to ‘yes’Ability to work in ambiguity and go getter attitude to winAbility to multi-task and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environmentComputer proficiency – experience using Salesforce.com or other Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools is preferredOutstanding oral and written communication skillsMust be detail oriented and capable of accurate work with minimal supervisionBachelor’s degree is preferredBenefits of Working at IronNet:IronNet strives to provide and takes pride in being able to offer comprehensive, essential and affordable benefits for our employees and their families. We offer an unlimited PTO plan, 401(k) match as well as Medical, Dental, Vision, and Disability Insurance.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Commercial Account Executive - East
description: Exabeam is the Smarter SIEM™ company. We help security operations and insider threat teams work smarter, allowing them to detect, investigate and respond to cyberattacks in 51 percent less time. Security organizations no longer have to live with excessive logging fees, missed distributed attacks and unknown threats, or manual investigations and remediation. With the modular Exabeam Security Management Platform, analysts can collect unlimited log data, use behavioral analytics to detect attacks, and automate incident response, both on-premise or in the cloud. Exabeam Smart Timelines, sequences of user and device behavior created using machine learning, further reduce the time and specialization required to detect attacker tactics, techniques and procedures.Position OverviewExabeam is looking for a Corporate Account Executive to grow and expand our market presence. This person will be responsible for driving sales efforts and working with ecosystem channel partners to maximize market adoption and domination. You will serve as the face and voice of Exabeam and effectively build out your respective region/territory, secure key wins and capture business. This role is focused on commercial accounts segment 1,000-2,500 users. You must have prior experience selling security related software / SaaS. Candidate should be based in: Eastern Time Zone, preferably in the Northeast Area (north of PA).ResponsibilitiesLead account strategy to generate new business growth and add to our portfolio of clients in a specific GeographyBuild and maintain strong and positive relationships within enterprise clientsIdentify customer requirements, influence strategic direction and buying decisionsDrive business development and effectively manage all buying cycles and pipelineWork as a cohesive team with Sale Engineers and cross functional team membersWork collaboratively with channel/reseller communityForecast accurately and achieve revenue targetsQualifications1-5 Years Territory Sales Experience, Security Software preferredSolid client facing / interpersonal skills; ability to build influential relationshipsTrack record of success and quota achievementAbility to effectively operate in fast paced, evolving environmentIntimacy/knowledge of the specific territory; must live in territoryIndustry domain / security software sales experienceExcellent written and spoken communication skillsStrategic and analytical thinking skills, able to plan, pitch and executeExperience using CRM/SalesforceUniversity degree or equivalent experienceExabeam is privately funded by Lightspeed Venture Partners, Cisco Investments, Norwest Venture Partners, Acrew Capital, Icon Ventures, and investor Shlomo Kramer. For more information visit https://www.exabeam.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: Cyber Security Research Engineer, Technology Firm
description: DescriptionThis is a great opportunity for you to be part of an innovative and fast-growing technology firm who uses emerging technology across AI, cyber security research, machine learning and data analytics to create tailored solutions for their clients.ResponsibilitiesYou will be involved in the identification, analysis and resolution of the security aspects of software and firmware designs and implementation, while recommending cyber defence and countermeasures for product designs. You will conduct security assessment and penetration testing using automated tools, ad-hoc tools, manual exploitation and reverse engineering, across web products, hardware products, wireless products, software, cloud based software and smart device applications. Based on your research into threat models and security assessments of cybersecurity services, platforms and infrastructure, you will then create security documentation, technical reports, and formal papers on test findings.RequirementsYou are degree qualified with hands-on experience with commercial and open source security solutions. Prior experience in malware/vulnerability research or reverse engineering would be highly beneficial.To ApplyTo apply, please submit your resume to Chen Yi at cy@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: CSA Construction Engineer
description: Micron’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Join an inclusive team focused on one thing: using our expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we create help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can spark the very innovation we are pursuing.Req. ID: 232403Overview / Responsibilities _ CSA Construction EngineerManages the civil, structural and architecture design, planning, construction and maintenance of equipment, machinery, buildings, and other facilities. Plans, budgets, and schedules facility modifications, including estimates on equipment, labor, materials and other related costs. Designs and develops organizational policies relevant to the facilities department. Oversees the coordination of building space allocation and layout, communication services and facilities expansion. May have responsibility for establishing and overseeing health and safety standards.Plans facilities changes for plant, office, and production equipment layouts, working toward economy of operation, maximum use of facilities and equipment, and compliance with laws and regulations. Coordinates with architecture/engineering firms in developing design criteria and preparing layout and detail drawings. Taking design input from Global Facility Technology Team (GFTT) and Micron MMP Facilities team to ensure capture in design drawing and specification. Prepares bid sheets and contracts for construction and facilities acquisition. Reviews and estimates design costs including equipment, installation, labor, materials, preparation and other related costs. Inspects construction and installation progress for conformance to established drawings, specifications, and schedules. Develops criteria and performance specifications required to meet unique operating requirements and building and safety codes. Coordinating mechanical system installation construction according to design and specification, manage design change due to site constraint, ensuring documentation submission approval such as shop drawing, equipment submittal, construction drawing, T&C method statement & plan, as-built drawing, O&M manual, cleanroom certification, sensor certificate in-place, warranty tracking etc.Manage overall construction schedule, scope of work and project budget. Tracking critical construction milestone. Liaison with authority department together with consultant teams for Plans submission, approval and inspection. Manage production customer request, coordinating meeting and ensure General Contractor performances.Design and Plan System and BuildingsCollaborate with core team to develop semiconductor CSA and Facility systems build, from basis of design to issue for constructions for project buildouts and major infrastructure upgrades.Create and design CSA systems ranging from Civil, Structure, Architecture, Exterior, Interior, Elevators and Infrastructure for buildings system set up and comply with local code & regulation.Develop comprehensive understanding drawings and specifications, phasing plan, structural systems.Manage all CSA system issues during concept design, detailed design, procurement, bidding, manufacturing, delivery, and installation on site.Ensure designs comply with all applicable standards, codes and regulations.Benchmark within and external to Micron sites on Engineering and Design Best Known Methods (BKM) of Facilities buildings and systems.Develop, own, and maintain Global System Standards, Specifications, and Best Known Methods (BKM) standards for system discipline.Review of the capacity planning databases, (with base build capacities, assignments and actual field conditions) across the network and validating Utilization and diversity factor assumptions.Provide system design for safe, reliable and efficient operations and maintenance; Provide and prepare all types of documents including: statement of work (SOW), total cost of ownership (TCO) analysis, concept designs, drawing markup, budget, schedule, factory test and acceptance documents, final startup/commissioning reports and review and acceptance of as-builts and submittals.Construction ExecutionReview and supervise the construction plan and report from contractor, ensure all works comply with required quality standards and industry standard best practices are being apply in the field.Implementation of CSA requirements in the installation and test plans of the Contractor for the detailed planning and construction phase until final takeover is completed.Support the project construction & safety management plan are fully implemented.Ensure Quality Assurance and Control (QAQC) of project deliverables, execute construction completed works is in proper condition and meet the requirement of specifications & function.Perform systems Test & Commissioning in accordance with requirement of Construction document and guarding the Owner against defects and deficiencies in the works.Minimum Experience & Skills:Suitable candidates are likely to have a minimum of 10-8 years working experience consist of 5 years’ experience in construction as construction engineer.Demonstrable experience in the managing of multi-disciplined semiconductor projects and/or other relevant industries is strongly preferred.Practiced in project control mechanisms and with commercial and technical risk assessmentsStrong communication skills, as well as the ability to visualize issues and communicate them to others.Outstanding organization and coordinating skills – ability to coordinate and motivate groups of Consultants / Contractors.Ability to work collaboratively and pro-actively in a team environment.About Micron Technology, Inc.We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careersAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.Micron prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations and other international and industry labor standards.Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.For US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 or 208-368-4748 and/or by completing our General Contact FormKeywords: Penang || Pulau Pinang (MY-07) || Malaysia (MY) || Backend Manufacturing || Experienced || Regular || Facilities/Site Services || #LI-JT2 || Tier 4 ||

title: Corporate Production Systems Engineer (IE)
description: CORPORATE PS ENGINEERMultiflex RNC Philippines, Inc. (Uratex)Km. 23 East Service Road South Super High-way Cupang, Muntinlupa CityDUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Hands-on support for one or more manufacturing processes to maximize plant efficiency.Participates in or leads process design, set up, implementation, and maintenance. Recommends revision to operating methods, material handling, equipment lay-out and other changes to increase production or improve standards.Optimizes work flow and lead times by organization of work and machine set-ups.Studies and records time, motion, methods, and speed to improve efficiency and establish a standard production rate in performance of maintenance, production, clerical, and other worker operations.Responsible for all documentation of the system and analysis.Update status of the project and reporting to Production System Mover.Reviews existing processes and equipment; suggests/recommends and validate kaizen improvements.Recommends modifications to existing quality or production standards to achieve optimum quality within limits of resource capability.Conduct weekly internal audit (compliance and sustenance).Monitor PS implementation. Promotes and monitors process effectiveness. Ensures adherence to policies, practices, and standards.Board and visual designs.Develops the Project Plan with the team.Responsible for on-time documentation of the system.Accountable for the sustenance of RGC PS-Board.Responsible for the issuance of CPAR for any incompliance of execution team in the system.JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Must be a graduate of BS Industrial EngineeringAt least 1 year experience in manufacturing Set-up as process engineerWell versed in Time and Motion studyProficient in Microsoft Office (Excel & Powerpoint)Knowledgeable in Autocad/Visio (is an advantage)Knowledge in 7QC ToolsKnowledge in conducting time and motion study.Amenable to travel - from time-to-timeJOB BENEFITS: In addition to an exciting and fulfilling career, we offer the following benefits:Health Maintenance Organization (Medicard)Annual Physical ExaminationYearly conversion of unused leave creditsMid-year performance evaluation bonus yearly through GPAEntitled to yearly salary increaseSponsored company events and activitiesCompany UniformsAllowancesFree ParkingLearning & Growth (Trainings)Employee engagement activitiesHealth & Fitness (Use of mini-gym and free zumba lessons)Special employee discounts on productsVisit our Official Website: http://uratex.com.phLike our Official Facebook Fan Page: http://www.facebook.com/uratexcareersJob Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:Production Systems: 2 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Work Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

title: Applied Scientist - Salesforce Research Asia
description: Salesforce Research Asia is looking for extraordinary applied scientist (research engineers). As an applied scientist, you will work with research scientists and engineers to develop and productize new cutting-edge models and associated artifacts such as data preparation pipeline and model characterization logic. You will ensure these models are developed to support accuracy, performance or other specific customer requirements. You will work with platform team to support deployment of these models. In other words, you are a problem solver, a deep learning model designer, and an engineer who makes sure the model is deployed at scale to serve our customers with state-of-the-art speech, vision, and language technologies.We believe that making substantive progress on hard applications can drive and sharpen the research questions we study, and, in turn, scientific breakthroughs can spawn entirely new applications. With this in mind, the team maintains a portfolio of projects, some with an immediate path to production, others that may not find an application for several years.You have a strong background in one or more of the following fields: natural language processing, deep learning, machine learning. Additionally, applicants should have in-depth experience with practical problems, such as text-to-speech (TTS), text categorization, machine translation, text summarization, sentiment analysis, question answering, dialogue systems, language and vision, etc.Responsibilities:Partner with product managers to understand customer requirementsConduct research (including reviewing relevant literature) and collaborate with our research team to identify appropriate solution candidatesDevelop prototypes, then design and carry out experiments to validate and improve the prototypesBring the ideas to productionMonitor model behaviors in production and iteratively improve quality of services over timeWork on cutting-edge research in machine learning

title: Senior Software Engineer - Data
description: MissionThe Data team is responsible for conceiving and delivering a range of data products. These may be used to assist in verification and management of users’ identity or financial risk assessment and be the first of their kind in SE Asia. We also provide high availability, high performance shared services to support enhanced payment experiences for merchants and users across the Xendit group. As a part of this process, we need to iterate quickly and discover what customers want, as well as design systems which are set up for future scale. As a senior member of the team, you will be responsible for hands-on delivery, laying out the technical roadmap and supporting your team through mentoring and coaching.ResponsibilitiesMaintain and improve mission critical data products that support the Xendit group, optimising for processing speed, fault tolerance and uptimeExperiment and rapidly prototype new data products for testing with clientsDevelop clear technical requirements and lead development of software to those standardsAdvance engineering standards, tooling and processes to build team efficiencyProactively define and maintain a long term technical roadmap for all data products, and deliver it on timeMentor and up-skill colleagues on a day-to-day basisDo whatever it takes to make Xendit succeedYou may be a good fit if youHave 4+ years of experience designing, developing and deploying large scale software applicationsHave a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in CS or equivalent experienceAre experienced in NodeJS and Python. Bonus points if you are a fullstack developer, have experience with crawlers and/or full end-to-end development including architecture design + CI/CDWorked on RESTful APIs, large-scale data and machine learning pipelinesTransition fluidly from big picture business requirements and company standards to writing detailed technical specifications and user storiesAre comfortable in an ambiguous or fast-paced startup environmentPick solutions that are fit for purpose, whether to drive continuous improvement on the core data products and rapid experimentation on newer areasDevelop MVPs that can be incrementally extended to production ready productsCommunicate well with data scientists, data engineers and the wide range of other teams relying on our data productsEnjoy talking with stakeholders to understand why a problem matters to themThrive on autonomy and have proven you can push towards a goal by yourselfBonus points if:You’ve worked specifically in a data product business that supplies identity verification, credit or fraud risk assessment productsYou’ve successfully moved products from MVP to rapid scaling afterwards

title: Technical Program Manager, APAC
description: In Singapore, the Global team is responsible for ensuring Stripe’s products best fit the unique needs of each country. You’ll get to work with engineers in the region to build delightful features that span various parts of the system, as well as working with our business, sales and operations teams to understand and solve our users’ pain points.As a technical program manager, you will be responsible for leading complex in-market initiatives, working across a multitude of functions at Stripe: launching new markets and payment methods, ensuring compliance with our regulatory and partner requirements, operationalizing licenses and developing new processes to improve compliance and fraud rates. As an active contributor to Stripe’s global strategy, your impact is felt across the company. You will identify alignment gaps across Stripe’s product portfolio. and spend a significant proportion of your time developing the capabilities of the team as a whole.You will:Drive functional and technical delivery of key team-, org-, and company-wide initiatives.Collaborate with engineering teams to design, scope, and shepherd features.Create functional specs, project / release plans, and roadmaps.Own and execute multiple infrastructure software engineering programs simultaneously.Help drive product decisions to align with higher company initiatives.Help influence peers / managers and build consensus while dealing with ambiguity.Guide and manage the usage of agile methodologies to simplify project delivery.You may be a fit for this role if you have:5+ years as a TPM, engineering leader or related discipline.Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering or a related field.Consistent track record of shipping products with broad customer impact.Demonstrable experience with agile software development methodologies and productivity tools.Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate and build relationships with highly technical management teams.Strong analytic and project management skills.Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve systemic issues.Interpersonal skills to build relationships, and collaborate with diverse cross-functional teams.It’s not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas—we’re looking for candidates that are particularly strong in at least one area, and have some interest and capabilities in the others.Nice-to-Have:Experience working on market expansionWeb or Internet start-up environment and technical infrastructure management experience.Exposure to large-scale systems, data center, operations, or computing infrastructure-related experience, including experience in multi-tiered distributed application environments.Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.“Nice to have” really means “nice to have”. It’s completely possible that you don’t have any of these and are still a great fit for the team.What’s it like to work at Stripe?Stripe is helping the internet fulfil its potential as a platform for economic progress by building software tools that accelerate global economic access and technological development. Stripe makes it easy to start, run and scale an internet business from anywhere in the world.Stripe is, at its heart, an engineering company. To provide a missing pillar of core internet infrastructure, we hire people with a broad set of technical skills (and from a wide variety of backgrounds) who are ready to take on some of the most challenging problems in the industry – from reliably handling 100M API requests per day, to building adaptive machine learning as a result of years of data science and infrastructure work, and enabling entrepreneurs worldwide to start a global internet business.We look at Stripe as a constant work in progress and the same is true of our people; for all of us, we believe the best is yet to come. We’re here to support each other in our curiosity and creativity – which we pursue through thoughtful discussion and knowledge-sharing among a diverse set of peers and colleagues.We encourage all engineers to transition teams once every year and a half and also take on short-term projects with other teams across Stripe. This enables engineers to learn how different parts of Stripe work while also establishing stronger ties and cross-pollination between groups.We contribute to existing open-source projects and the people working on them, and we release several tools as open-source.We want to work in a company of warm, inclusive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well. The kind of people who are committed to going out of their way to help other Stripes in the short-term and pushing them to improve over the long-term (by helping them to get better at what they do).We’re a highly cross-functional organization and view that as part of the fun: we design our space to encourage as much collaboration as possible. We have long tables in the kitchen for a reason (to enable everyone to meet new people and learn from them). We also have a culture of transparency that we carry through to email communication, ensuring that Stripes all around the world have the information they need to make good local decisions.In both our products and our people, we aim to reflect, represent and advocate for all of our users, globally. Our users transcend geography, culture and language; what we share, collectively, is a drive to create a fairer, more economically interconnected world.

title: Network Engineer/ Secops
description: We are looking for a Passionate Network engineer L2. description: FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 90+ countries make better decisions. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financingGlobal trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at www.fico.com/CareersFICO values the benefit that diversity and a culture of inclusion bring to our workplace. We are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

title: Engineering Manager, Static Asset Platform
description: Deliver best-in-class web experiences to Stripe users around the worldStripe users around the world use our web properties to create beautifully functional checkout flows, manage every aspect of their business, learn how to deepen their Stripe integration, and get in touch with us when they need help. Secure and efficient delivery of the static assets for these properties is just as important as delivery of our API itself: when these surfaces are down, real businesses lose real money.The Static Asset Platform team exists to create a seamless internal experience for the development, deployment, and monitoring of the static assets powering products like stripe.com, the Stripe Dashboard, stripe.js, and Stripe Checkout. The team will partner closely with product teams to provide common development and deployment infrastructure and serve as a single consulting team with expertise in delivering these web experiences reliably and securely.We are looking for a manager who is excited about building reliable infrastructure for static asset delivery in service of excellent end-user and internal development experiences. The right candidate for this role will enjoy leading a team and partnering with engineers and managers across the company to solve challenging problems in this area of our systems.You will:Work with product and engineering leaders across the company to identify the work necessary to enable new product launches and increase the stability, security, and efficiency of our existing web properties.Develop a roadmap for the internal developer experience for static assets and for the tooling we use to configure, operate, and monitor our multiple Content Delivery Network providers.Own the commercial relationship with these CDN providers, maximizing value for Stripe by thoughtfully approaching build-vs-buy questions.Empower engineers with the agency and control they need to develop operationally efficient systems, supporting the team in achieving a high level of technical quality and ease-of-use.Recruit great engineers in collaboration with Stripe’s recruiting team and develop each team member to help them advance in their career.Manage processes to help the team do its best work and engage effectively with the rest of Stripe.Contribute to engineering-wide initiatives as a member of Stripe’s engineering management team.You may be a good fit if you have done some of these:You have managed teams that have shipped and operated critical infrastructure at scaleYou have worked in making software systems more reliable and secureYou have worked with geographically distributed teamsYou have successfully recruited and built great teamsYou thrive on a high level of autonomy and responsibilityYou are clear and persuasive in writing and in conversationYou are excited about collaborating with teammates across engineeringWhat’s it like to work at Stripe?Stripe is helping the internet fulfill its potential as a platform for economic progress by building software tools that accelerate global economic access and technological development. Stripe makes it easy to start, run and scale an internet business from anywhere in the world.Stripe is, at its heart, an engineering company. To provide a missing pillar of core internet infrastructure, we hire people with a broad set of technical skills (and from a wide variety of backgrounds) who are ready to take on some of the most challenging problems in the industry – from reliably handling 100M API requests per day, to building adaptive machine learning as a result of years of data science and infrastructure work, and enabling entrepreneurs worldwide to start a global internet business.We look at Stripe as a constant work in progress and the same is true of our people; for all of us, we believe the best is yet to come. We’re here to support each other in our curiosity and creativity – which we pursue through thoughtful discussion and knowledge-sharing among a diverse set of peers and colleagues.We encourage all engineers to transition teams once every year and a half and also take on short-term projects with other teams across Stripe. This enables engineers to learn how different parts of Stripe work while also establishing stronger ties and cross-pollination between groups.We contribute to existing open-source projects and the people working on them, and we release several tools as open-source.We want to work in a company of warm, inclusive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well. The kind of people who are committed to going out of their way to help other Stripes in the short-term and pushing them to improve over the long-term (by helping them to get better at what they do).We’re a highly cross-functional organization and view that as part of the fun: we design our space to encourage as much collaboration as possible. We have long tables in the kitchen for a reason (to enable everyone to meet new people and learn from them). We also have a culture of transparency that we carry through to email communication, ensuring that Stripes all around the world have the information they need to make good local decisions.In both our products and our people, we aim to reflect, represent and advocate for all of our users, globally. Our users transcend geography, culture and language; what we share, collectively, is a drive to create a fairer, more economically interconnected world.

title: Mold Tool Design Engineer
description: Company DescriptionLocation: Robert Bosch Automotive Technologies (Thailand) Co., Ltd., Hemaraj Industrial Estate, Tasith, Pluak Daeng, Rayong, ThailandDo you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the area of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology of energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.This site is the integral manufacturing plant and R&D Center. It is the first smart factory in Thailand. It will enable us to respond to growing automobile production in Thailand and to serve international as well as local automotive customers on the spot. The supplier of technology and services is focusing heavily on connected manufacturing at the factory.Manufacturing Plant: The Company is constructing its first plant of the manufacturing of gasoline injection systems in Thailand. It is capable of production 1 million fuel injector units every year. With the new fuel injector plant we are able to meet the increasing demand of our customers in the region.R&D Center: The R&D office and laboratory are located on same site as production. In order to have dedicated laboratory accommodating automotive specific machine and equipment such as fuel testing benches and Noise, Vibration, Harshness chambers.Job DescriptionFunctional Area: Technical Engineering FunctionDesign and develop production mold tool and process to meet customer requirements on technical specifications and qualityCollaborate with team to provide fast solution for mold tool and track progress on mold tool repairs and modificationsWork with Production Engineering to develop mold tool and systems to optimize production efficiencyProvide support for relocation mold tool in production including spares part managementWork within the constraints of timeline and scope to manage risk of the new mold tool projectLead team supplier in problem solving – identification of problems and analysis of the root cause of new mold tool projectMold tool drawing management controlQualificationsEducation:Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or related degreeLanguages:Fluent in ThaiGood Command in EnglishExperience and Knowledge:3 to 5 years experience with 3D CAD designWorking knowledge in plastic mold tool industry, mold tool design and plastic injection process.Active learning, Judgment, Time management and organizational skillsStrong work ethic with a high degree of flexibilityAdditional InformationYour future job offers youhousing allowance, company shuttle, free lunch, provident fund, medical benefits, OPD, IPD, dental benefits, performance bonus, service year reward, insurance, diligent allowance, marriage allowance, new born gift, oversea allowance, etc.Make it happenSend us your application by using the I'm interested button!Interested applicants are invited to submit your CV, current & expected salary, and contact information.Follow us on Facebook : Bosch Thailand Career
